name: plugout_tta
author: AFNI Developers
description: Connects to AFNI and receives notification whenever the user changes Talairach coordinates, then drives Netscape to display the closest figures from the Talairach-Tournoux atlas.

inputs.description: Connect to AFNI running on the specified computer using TCP/IP. Use '-host localhost' to connect on current host with TCP/IP.
inputs.name: Host

inputs.description: Use TCP/IP port number 'pp'. Default is 8005.
inputs.name: Port Number

inputs.description: Verbose mode: prints out progress reports.
inputs.name: Verbose Flag

inputs.description: Provide a port offset to allow multiple instances of programs to communicate on the same machine. All ports are assigned numbers relative to PORT_OFFSET. Range: [1025, 65500].
inputs.name: Port Offset

inputs.description: Like -np, but more quiet in the face of adversity.
inputs.name: Port Offset Quiet

inputs.description: Provide a port offset block. Easier to use than -np. Range: [0, MAX_BLOC]. Using this reduces chances of port conflicts.
inputs.name: Port Offset Block

inputs.description: Print the current value of MAX_BLOC and exit.
inputs.name: Max Port Block

inputs.description: Print MAX_BLOC value and exit quietly.
inputs.name: Max Port Block Quiet

inputs.description: Print the number of assigned ports used by AFNI then quit.
inputs.name: Number of Assigned Ports

inputs.description: Print the number of assigned ports used by AFNI then quit quietly.
inputs.name: Number of Assigned Ports Quiet
